Cause: Wrong IP address or device offline
Solution: Ping device first then check port 502 is open

Cause: Port not open or firewall blocking
Solution: Check firewall rules and Modbus TCP enabled on device

Cause: Wrong baud rate parity or stop bits
Solution: Match serial settings exactly with device manual

Cause: Register address does not exist on device
Solution: Check device manual for valid register range. Note 0-based vs 1-based addressing
Command: Modbus exception code 02 means invalid address

Cause: Value out of valid range for register
Solution: Check min/max values in device documentation
Command: Modbus exception code 03 means invalid value

Cause: Wrong data type or scaling factor
Solution: Verify INT16/UINT16/INT32/FLOAT32 and apply correct scale factor
Check cable shielding and termination resistors
Command: Use 120 ohm termination at both ends of RS485

Solution: Check gateway-to-device connection and slave ID

Cause: Big endian vs little endian mismatch
Solution: Try swapping byte order (word swap and/or byte swap)
Command: Some devices use ABCD others use CDAB or BADC

Solution: Verify certificates match between client and broker

Command: mosquitto_pub -u user -P pass -h broker -t test -m test

Cause: Wrong topic name or no publishers
Solution: Verify exact topic string including wildcards
Check IOA mapping in RTU configuration
Command: IOAs are 3 bytes typically starting from 1

Solution: Check if type is handled in your implementation
